loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and has five children who still attend school. This is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mupa has been cooking and selling food in a hotel for the past one year, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in their society.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is a 41-year-old married father of two children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2000. It is his only business and that's why he has to work hard to develop it -- to make sure it will provide him with a good encouraging income. 

Zahi is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to do necessary maintenance for his car. This loan will be invested in fixing his car's gear box.

He hopes that one day he'll be financially capable of buying a new car to replace the current old one. That would attract new customers and develop his living.

loans.use: To fix his car's gear box.

loans.name: Asalia

texts.en:
Asalia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Asalia has been working hard to manage her silver fish business. 

To help expand her business, Asalia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add fish stock and will help Asalia to generate greater profits. It will also supplement her siblings school fees. Asalia hopes that in the future she will be able to sell charcoal as her side income. 

Asalia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add fish stock.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old and married to Sarah, who is a businesswoman. The couple is from Nakuru and blessed with four children ages six, 10, 14 and 16. For the past eight years, David has been a charcoal vender who makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

David is requesting a 22,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell to meet his increasing customer demand. This will be his second loan from KADET. David will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes and dreams of a prosperous future in business and family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rezeq

texts.en:
Rezeq is 23 years old and a single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. For the past eight years, Rezeq has been selling construction materials. This is a good business that has good market demand.
 
Rezeq is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy more construction materials to sell to develop his store. His loan will increase his sales and income. Rezeq appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years old and married to Maria. The couple is blessed with three children ages one, four, and eight. Samuel is from Nakuru. For the last 13 years, he has been a butcher and his monthly income right now is 20,000 KES. 

Samuel is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy some goats to slaughter and sell the meat to his customers. This will be his second loan. Samuel is planning to use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children and repay his loan. In the future, he hopes to expand into animal sales.

loans.use: to buy some goats for slaughter

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 25 years old, married to John, and they have been blessed with one child of 1 year old.

She sells mitumba (plastic wrapped packages of used clothes) and she has been in business for two years. Right now her monthly income is KSH 26,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000 in order more purchase more stock of clothes. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her first loan and her hopes are to prosper in business and her family too.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr: Monsieur Kalidou lui  est producteur agricole de profession. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans son activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer  vers les coups de 20h. Disposant d’un périmètre agricole  Kalidou a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des semences d’oignon et des intrants agricoles. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de la maison et celle des enfants. Il habite dans les environs du guichet dans un village de maraichage. A l’avenir Kalidou voudrait exploiter d’autres périmètres  agricoles afin de diversifier son production et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalidou is a cultivator by trade. He has more than 25 years of experience in this business. He starts his days at 8 a.m. and finishes it at 8 p.m. He owns some land and, at this time, he needs this loan to buy onion seeds and agricultural inputs.

He covers the daily expenses of his household, and those of the children. He lives in a farming village, close to the MFI's office. In the future, he would like to cultivate more land in order to diversify his production and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 24-year-old man. He is married to Jane and is a father of one child who is 2 years old. David has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years and is making a monthly income of KES 12,000.

David learned about KADET from fellow riders who are already being funded by KADET. He has been advanced a first loan of KES 87,880 which will assist him to buy his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more as he has already capitalized on transportation of farm produce for the women in the market.

He will use the proceeds to repay the loan as well as meet his young family's basic needs. He hopes to diversify into crop farming with the savings of the business.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married and supports a family of four people. She has a grocery shop. She has been in business for 20 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 12,500.

Jane is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000 which she intends to use to purchase more cereals for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to improve her business. This her third loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to add more cereals to her shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old. She is from Nakuru. She is married and her spouse earns some additional income for the family. They are blessed with two children aged 24 and 22 years old.

Jane owns a clothing shop where she deals in children's wears, ladies' wear and all types of handbags. She has been running this business for the past 33 years. To enable her to add more stocks in her shop to sell to her customers, she has applied for her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET.

Her monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and her intention is to buy more stocks for her business with the profits realized from her expanded business so as to have enough stock to sell to her customers during the festive season that is approaching.

She hopes to own the biggest clothing shop in her town in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of new clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is single and has two children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Charity is now an established businesswoman. She sells provisions in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about three years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Charity uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Charity will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charity plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Leocadia is one of the members of the group Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking to the Future) 1 & 7. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris, where the group's members sell various products like food, clothes, shoes, etc.

Leocadia makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. For the past six years she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall where, in addition to fruits and vegetables, she sells meat, charcoal, etc. She started her business with her own savings.

Leocadia is excited to be a part of this loan, her 11th with Esperanza, after having repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business inventory by buying plantains, onions, cassava, bananas, oranges, chickens, coriander, greens products, etc.

Leocadia says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Sarah is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bowls and cooking utensils in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for two and a half years. Sarah is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Sarah wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bowls and utensils. In the long term, Sarah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bowls and utensils.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso Group

texts.en:
Marina is the coordinator of her group Con Dios Adelante al Progreso ("Forward Progress with God"). The group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugarcane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a single mother. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them. 

Marina is excited to be seeking her 10th loan with Esperanza. She started doing business almost nine years ago, at first walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics and shoes. Now after taking out some loans, she has increased her sales and has run other businesses, like selling chickens in her community. 

Marina plans to use this loan to invest in her business, and she will continuing selling live chickens for her neighbors' daily meals. She will also increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous items like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (clothing, shoes, cosmetics) and meat to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Gladys is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking pots in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. As a divorcee with six children, Gladys uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Gladys will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of pots, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Gladys wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells maize in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been doing so for about five years. As a divorcee with three children, Esi uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is a single mother of a 17 year old and and twins of 12 years.

She has a business of selling new clothes, which she has been running for the last 10 years. Her monthly income right now is KES 100,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd., which will be used for buying more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

Her intention is to use the profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children, buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers and pay back her loan to KADET Ltd.

Her hopes for the future are to be successful and for her family to be happy and prosperous.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Naivasha area of Kenya, which lies in the Rift Valley, east of Nairobi. He owns a tree nursery that he has been running for three years. He is married and has five children.

Patrick will use both the loan and the anticipated profits to purchase more seeds for his nursery. He has a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings. He repaid his previous loan and has now applied for a new loan which was approved.

His dream is to own the biggest tree nursery in Naivasha.

Note: Kadet used a tablet to create this borrower's profile, which reduces paper consumption, and makes their operations more efficient, thus reducing costs.

loans.use: To buy more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married. They are blessed with six children who are all adults.

Elizabeth owns a private primary school in Ndunyu Njeru which she has been running for thirteen years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to buy building materials to add more classes. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her business and provide scholarships.

In the near future, she hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet to improve her school and her students' livelihood.

loans.use: To buy building materials to expand her school.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 37-year-old lady who is married and a mother of two children. For the past six years, she has been a farmer in Limuru. Mary earns a monthly income of 13,800 KES. 

Mary is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to buy a calf and use some money to repair her calf shed. This will be her first loan with KADET. In future, Mary wants to own more cows and supply her whole village with milk. She also wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a calf and repair her calf shed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old lady who is married to George. Together, they have three children. For the past eight years, Grace has been a dairy farmer in Kiambaa, in the outskirts of Limuru. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Grace is requesting a loan to by a cow. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. In the future, Grace wants to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 48-year-old lady who is married and a mother of five children who are all in school. For the past three years, she has run a general shop in Limuru. Annah’s monthly income is 1,400 KES. 

Annah is requesting a loan with KADET LTD to buy items such as cooking oil, milk, sugar, rice, and other products for her store. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. In the future, Annah wants to educate her children and also open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, milk, sugar, rice, and other products

loans.name: Parwin

texts.en:
Parwin is a 46-year-old widowed women. After her husband's death, she faced a hard time supporting her son. Without proper education or a steady job, she started her own business and bought a sewing machine.

When she heard about Izdiharona for Economic Development's Alqard Alhasan product (without interest product for widow women that helps them to increase their income), she took a loan to replace her sewing machine and buy a table, an iron and a chair to improve the quality of her work. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits and be able to provide the best life for her son. 

The story of Parwin and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a table, an iron and a chair.

loans.name: Eglal Group

texts.en:
Eglal group consists of three ladies from Taiz, Yemen. Each member has their own type of business. They have requested a group loan of YER 180,000 and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Eyman is 29 years old. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. The income of her husband is not enough to cover living expenses and the rent of their house, so she decided to apply for a YER 60,000 loan from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is 32 years old. He has an Arabic clothes shop. He is married and has two children. Haidar has a smart beautiful girl named Isra. She is in first grade. He always worries about making enough money and saving some of it for his daughter’s school expenses. Every year, Haidar faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover school fees, a uniform, and books. 

With this loan now, Haidar can accommodate all these expenses. He is requesting a loan to pay for his daughter's tuition fees and other school expenses. Isra aims to be a nurse.
 
The story of Haidar and his daughter is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en:
Gordana is a 60-year-old married woman living only with her husband in the southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. Her children are married. 

Based on tradition, Gordana and her husband work together in an agricultural business by cultivating their land and by owning a cow. This provides for the family needs as well as an income from selling the fresh milk to a local dairy farm and other dairy products for the area.
 
Lately, they have been fortunate enough to have demand from the neighborhood for their milk and products and have been able to make a good living and profit in this manner. In order to generate even more income, she is requesting a loan to increase the amount of cows she owns and continue to keep multiplying their cows, business and profit. She is aware that without KosInvest/Kiva's support, her goal would be difficult to achieve. She really appreciates the support from the lenders.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Kanuma Group

texts.fr:
Misigaro fait partie du groupe  Kanuma et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 41 ans est marié à Violette. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 1 à 12 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de chèvres   depuis 19 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait avoir 3 points de vente et voir les enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Misigaro is a member of Kanuma Group and lives in Bubanza. He's 41 years old and married to Violette. Together, they have four children, aged 1 to 12. Out of them, two go to school.

Misigaro has been selling goats for nineteen years. This is his first loan with Kiva's partner, Turame. He will use it to increase his working capital and buy many goats, in order to earn more.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to have three points of sale and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy many goats

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 19 years old and has one child who is currently in school. She lives in the town of Kaliro, in Uganda. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

Sarah is requesting a 450,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to stock more clothes to sell. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and help her to buy iron sheets to complete her house. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bank account and start saving some money. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Vida decided to set up her own tomato business in Asokor (near Takoradi). With more than three years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. She will use this loan to purchase more tomatoes for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a carpenter) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soft drinks in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Ama is married to a farmer and has four children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory of soft drinks.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Zenabu is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking pots in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Zenabu is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Zenabu will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of pots, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zenabu plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is divorced and has nine children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Comfort is a successful businesswoman. She sells salt in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Comfort uses her income to provide for the entire family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of salt, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase salt for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells second-hand clothing in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been educated till the end of junior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a machine operator. Grace has been working in this enterprise for two years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her second-hand clothing enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Even though Nana grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Nana is an entrepreneur. She sells fish in Asokor (near Takoradi). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. Nana is married and has three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Nana wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Nana plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fish.

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza sells cooking pots in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a mason. Adiza has been selling pots for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of pots, thus allowing her to meet rising demand from her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all of her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Grace is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling infant clothing in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Grace is single without any children and is a junior high school graduate. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. 

Grace wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of infant clothing. In the long term, Grace plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory of infant clothing.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells kerosene in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been doing so for about 20 years. As a divorcee with four children, Ekua uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of kerosene, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene for resale

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она одна воспитывает своего единственного сына, которому 17 лет. Гулбахор более 5 лет работает в местной больнице. Она работает заведующим отделом кадров. Гулбахор трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому выполняет свою функцию отлично. Гулбахору очень тяжело справляться с семейными расходами. Она хочет отправить сына в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы он там зарабатывал деньги и помогал ей по обеспечению семьи. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a cheerful woman. She is 45 years old and has a 17 year old son. Gulbahor has worked in the personnel department of a local hospital for more than five years. She is a hard-working woman and does her job well. She does her best to handle all of the family's expenses. She wants to send her son to Russia so that he can earn money there and help her support the family. Gulbahor has asked for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy the plane ticket for her son. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket for her son

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a mother who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a mat business at the market, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase weaving materials: palm leaves and needles. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials: palm leaves and needles.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a hardworking woman who is doing her best to support her family. She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy weaving materials and palm leaves for her business. Chizi appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials and palm leaves for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells pastries in Asokor (near Takoradi). She was educated till the end of junior high school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Rebecca has been working in this enterprise for two years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her baking enterprise and increase her capital base. 

In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock of pastries

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married to a driver, and she has three children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

A junior high school graduate, Gladys currently sells fish and rice is Asokor (near Takoradi). With over three years of experience in this trade, Gladys sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Thus her loan will be used to buy more rice and fish, helping her boost her overall sales. Gladys wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. 

As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her fish and rice enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more rice and fish, boosting her overall sales.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married, with five children. She has received some schooling till the end of junior high school.  Her husband is a driver. Cynthia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay the family's general expenses. 

Currently, Cynthia sells cookware in Asokor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about eight years now.

Cynthia will use the loan to increase her stocks of cookware. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Cynthia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of cookware.

loans.name: Tauilo

texts.en: Tauilo is a 38-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tauilo has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Tauilo hopes to improve and expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar

loans.name: Ma Auxiliadira

texts.es:
Doña Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad una mujer muy luchadora y con muchos sueños e ideales en la vida, ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y estudian en una escuela de la comunidad viviendo en su casa de habitación su esposo, sus 4 hijos ella y una hermana. Ella cuanta con la primaria incompleta que no pudo terminar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres a quien ellas agradece el esfuerzo y el apoyo brindado mientras ella estudio. Doña Auxiliadora se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de papa desde hace muchos años ya que en su juventud no solo la educaron con principios y valores sino también a ver el valor del trabajo siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra. Sus cultivos están ubicados muy cerca de su casa de habitación a los cuales se trasladan a pie en compañía de su esposo siendo ellos 2 los únicos involucrados.
Sus metas y sus sueños es forjar un patrimonio fuerte poder comprar un lote de tierra el cual sirva como medio de ingresos y en un futuro como patrimonio para sus hijos y los futuros venideros para que tengan donde trabajar, donde construir sus hogares y poder generar ingresos para sus familias. Por lo que hoy en día está solicitando un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos como, foliares, abono, fertilizantes, semilla certificada de papa entre otros para poder asistir y sembrar nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Doña Auxiliadora is 37 years old. She is a very feisty woman with many dreams and ideals in life. She is the mother of four minor children who are attneding a school in the community. She, her husband, her four children and her sister live together.

She was unable to complete primary school due to the lack of economic support from her parents, to whom she is grateful for the help they did provide while she attended school.

Doña Auxiliadora has made a living planting and cultivating potatoes for many years because her parents not only taught her principles and values in her youth but also the value of work. It was they who taught her how to work the land. 

Her crops are located very close to her house. That is where she travels on foot accompanied by her husband, the two of them being the only ones involved.

Her goals and dreams are to build wealth so they can buy a plot of land which will serve as a means of income and in the future as a legacy for her children and their descendants. Thus they will have a place to work, build their homes and generate income for their families. So, today she is requesting financing in order to purchase supplies, such as foliar fertilizers, compost, manure and certified seed potatoes, among other items, so that she can take care of and plant new crops.

loans.use: to purchase certified seed potatoes and farming supplies to plant and care for her crops.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña María Gabriela es una señora de 57 años de edad la cual es casada, agricultora y madre de 2 hijos los cuales también se dedican a la agricultura ya que en sus padres les enseñaron a trabajar el cultivo de hortalizas, granos básicos y demás. Su grado educativo es  primaria completa y no pudo continuar estudiando por más esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres como ella también ya que desciende de una familia de escasos recurso económicos. Doña María Gabriela desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo particularmente al cultivo de hortalizas (papa) lo cual pudo reforzar conocimientos gracias a las diferentes capacitaciones recibidas por una institución que está situada en la comunidad junto a su esposo. Sus cultivos están ubicados a diez minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación involucrándose al final de la temporada sus hijos ella y su esposo para la recolección de la papa.
Ella hoy día solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas, semilla de papa y maíz para cultivar ya que de esta manera este ella podrá extender sus cultivos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de hortaliza y granos básicos ya que de esta forma ella podrá obtener mayores ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y que le permita brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos además anhela fortalecer el patrimonio de ellos.
texts.en:
María Gabriela is 57 years old and is married. She is a farmer and has 2 children who also work in agriculture since their parents have taught them how to grow vegetables, basic grains and other produce. She has completed primary education and was unable to continue studying no matter how hard she and her parents tried, since she comes from a family of limited economic means. 

María Gabriela has worked in agriculture for 10 years with her husband, particularly in growing vegetables (potatoes), for which she was able to increase her knowledge thanks to various training courses which she and her husband received from an institution in their community. Their crops are a ten minute walk away from their home and María Gabriela and her husband and children all get involved in harvesting the potatoes at the end of the season.

Today she is asking for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy agricultural supplies, seed potatoes and corn for cultivation as this will help her to extend her crops and improve her income. In the future she dreams of increasing her crops by sowing and growing a larger quantity of vegetables and basic grains, since by doing this she will be able to increase her income to bring up her family and give her children a better education. She is also eager to strengthen her assets for her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, seed potatoes and certified corn for cultivation.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady est une promotrice qui habite à notto. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce de poissons frais, elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Métrisant bien son activité, ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de roulement pour satisfaire sa forte demande. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui soutienne son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Khady commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 14h. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady is an entrepreneure who lives in Notto. She sells fresh fish, and she has over 10 years of experience in this activity. 

She has a good command of her activity and expects that this credit will help to bolster her working capital to satisfy high demands from her customers. 

She is married with children, and she supports her husband with the management of the household’s daily expenditures.

Khady works from 8 AM until 2 PM. 

For the future, she hopes to boost her income in order to be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale at the market.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and operates a small fishing supply store and for many years has been selling items such as fishing gear and goggles. Ana needs a loan to buy more fishing gear, googles, spears, life jackets and coolers. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, googles, spears, life jackets and coolers

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her five children, who still depend on her income and care. Srey’s main business is farming as she  learned to work the land from her parents and other older people. It’s the most important source of income for her family and she has been involved in this business for almost 15 years with the support of her husband and children.

Srey has had four loans already prior to this loan. She mentioned that the previous loans really helped her to improve her business and their living conditions. As her house is under construction, Srey will use the new loan to buy building supplies to complete the unfinished parts of her house. She will also use a small portion of the loan to buy fishing nets for her husband's fishing activities. Srey and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful for their support.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to complete the unfinished parts of her house.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is dreaming of finishing his studies and having a successful career. In his determination and trust, he always finds ways to help his parents find solutions financially. His farmer is a farmer, and he has four siblings who need parental support, too.

Elmer is studying  BS - Information Technology at Misamis University in Oroquieta City.  He joined GDMPC and obtained an education loan offered to students. PHP 10,000 will help Elmer to cover the costs of the courses required in this semester. 

He is thankful that God helps him find ways. In the future, Elmer wants to support his siblings and the entire family to improve their living.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his courses this semester

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Cette femme habite aux environs du guichet et son activité principale est l’achat et la vente des légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans cette activité. Elle s’appelle DABA, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. DABA demande ce crédit d’un montant de 50.000F pour acheter des légumes et les revendre en suite.  Elle commence sa journée à 9h du matin pour la terminer à 13h de l’après-midi. Elle souhaite à l’avenir développer son activité afin d’augmenter ses revenus et pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman lives near the local U-IMCEC branch. Her main activity is buying and selling vegetables. She has over 15 years of experience in this activity. 

Her name is DABA, and she is married with children. She helps her husband with the household’s daily expenditures and the children’s tuition fees. 

DABA is seeking a loan of 50,000F to buy vegetables for resale. She works from 9 AM until 1 PM. 

In the long term, she wants to expand her activity in order to bolster her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Sia Eva

texts.en:
This is 46 year-old Sia Eva.  She is divorced, with four children, ages 36,15,12, and 10 years.

In 1998, Sia Eva established her drinks (bar) business. She began her business because she wanted to assist herself in taking care of the home. Working 7 days a week and 20 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 . Sia Eva requires a loan in order to buy more drinks for resale.

In the future, Sia Eva plans to get a house for herself to run her bar business. 

She is very hard-working  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale at her bar

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 24 years old, partnered, and has two children. She runs a small business selling meat pies in her community, which she has been doing for four years. 

Emma is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy chickens, onions, large pot, soy sauce, garlic, and gas burner. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Emma will help with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, onions, large pot,soy sauce, garlic, and gas burner

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old and ahs a degree in business information systems. He is passionate about IT, especially new technology and he is always eager and excited to learn and use new developments in IT.

He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for the internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience in IT, which will help him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years he sees himself as a consultant helping young businesses and entrepreneurs in his community implement IT to better their businesses and ideas. He feels that young people are very talented and have great ideas on how to better themselves. The greatest challenge he has faced is getting the right education that is suited for todays market. He hopes that he will get the necessary skills to enable him be a success.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 25 years old and he is from a family of five. Computers and applications have always interested him since he was a young boy. Technology and the impact it has had on civilization has fascinated him, hence generating a passion for information technology. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience, which will help him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years he sees himself being a competent IT professional working in an organization with a good reputation. He gets motivation from his day to day experiences and experiences of others. His experiences make him realize that there are many vital qualities that he lacks, which stalls his progress. This realization rejuvenates his desire to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo tiene 66 años, está casado con Luciana y tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos hasta ser mayores, excepto su pequeña Sulma de 11 años que vive junto a el y su esposa en su casa hecha de abobe.Es un agricultor muy conocido en su zona por los años que vive en su comunidad y la labor que desempeña. Creció desde muy niño junto a sus padres con la agricultura ya que fue el principal sustento económico desde sus abuelos. Tiene mas de 50 años de experiencia en su labor y a contado desde siempre con el apoyo de su esposo con quien tiene toda una vida de trabajo y dedicación por el bienestar de su familia.
Actualmente continúa con la producción de cacao, barbasco, palillo y árboles frutales como el plátano y cocos.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está primera oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra de plantas de almácigo para reemplazar varios árboles de cacao que están malogrados y adquirir sacos de abono orgánico para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 66 years old and is married to Luciana. He is proud to have provided for his children until they were adults, apart from his young daughter Sulma who is 11 years old and lives with him and his wife in their adobe house. As a farmer he is well known in the area for the work he does and because he has lived in the community for many years. He grew up with agriculture from a very young age alongside his parents, since it was the main source of income from his grandparents. He has more than 50 years' experience in this work and has always had the support of his wife with whom he has worked and dedicated his life to the wellbeing of his family. Currently he is growing cocoa, barbasco, turmeric and fruit trees such as banana and coconut. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he is getting to make progress in life. He also promises to pay his loan instalments punctually. On this first occasion he wants 2,000 nuevo soles to invest in his land by buying seedlings so he can replace several cocoa bushes which are in poor condition and he also wants to buy bags of organic manure to improve his crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Emile est une présidente du collectif de crédit « Amka », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans  et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son conjoint un médecin vétérinaire de la division publique. La cliente est  une vendeuse de viande.  Elle installe ses marchandises  dans une boucherie au coté du marché public, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 quartiers de vaches et 2 porcs. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une charcuterie moderne. Les insécurités dans les zones d’élevages, les menaces de fermiers par les inciviques, le manque de froid, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Emile, is a president of the loan collective "Amka". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 45 years old, and a mother of ten children, all students. Her husband is a veterinarian in the public sector. This client sells meat. She sets up in a butcher shop next to the public market and sometimes at home. She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for seven years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 2 quarters of beef and 2 pigs. Thus, she would like to provide education to her children, expand her business plans, and build a modern delicatessen. The challenges of developing her business include lack of safety in livestock farming areas, farmer threats, lack of refrigeration, outstanding payments, and exchange losses. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase cows and pigs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn is 56 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $11 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sarorn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 41 years old and the loving mother of three school-aged children. She lives with her family in a thatched house located in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Like other villagers, Neang is in the business of farming rice. She owns a few pieces of farmland for rice cultivation and is able to make a decent income of KHR 30,000 per day. Aside from the farming source of income, Neang is granted another source from her husband, who is involved in fishing.

As the old boat needs to be fixed and she has insufficient money to buy a new boat motor, she decided to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 from HKL, one of Kiva's field partners. This purchase will make their fishing business more sustainable and productive. Neang and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to fix their boat and buy a new boat motor.

loans.name: Matamoros Group

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene la edad de 52 años, solo estudio la primaria y está soltera, ella es otro de los integrantes del grupo Matamoros. 
Ella platica que desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar para salir adelante y durante 24 años se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo de todo un poco para ganarse la vida ella dijo “yo nunca le he tenido miedo al trabajo  y no me gusta estar sin hacer nada siempre busco la manera de hacer mis ventas para ganar mi dinero” 
Ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, ropa y perfumería, sus ventas de antojitos las hace a diario  desde su hogar, un día antes levanta pedidos y al siguiente sala a entregarlos, ella trabaja como cocinera en un pequeño restauran de su comunidad y ahí aprovecha para ofrecer con sus compañeras de trabajo y clientes su ropa y perfumería, también por la tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa y como ya es conocida en ocasiones le hacen pedidos y ella los surte, Narcisa es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a comprar variedad de perfumes, ropa (camisa, blusas, playeras, pantalones, vestidos, short, faldas y ropa interior) y aceite, frijoles, tortillas, crema, queso, lechuga, carne de pollo y res, chiles, papas, cebollas, tomates y ajos para la preparación de sus antojitos.

Ella espera que su negocio continúe progresando y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
 
Marisol venta de refrescos,
Berenice estética, 
Ignacia venta de comida,
Ysidra venta de abarrotes, 
Aeropajita venta de lencería,
Rosa Aurora venta de comida,
Rosa venta de refrescos,
Domingo venta de calzado,
Nelly sastrería.
texts.en:
52-year old Narcisa is single and has only primary education. She is one of the members of the Matamoros group. Ever since she was a young girl she has been in business selling a little of everything to make a living. She notes, 'I have never been afraid of work. I don't like having nothing to do, and I'm always looking for ways to earn money.'

Currently Narcisa sells Mexican food, clothing, and perfume. The snacks she makes daily in her house according to the orders she has from the previous day, and then delivers them. She works as a cook in a small local restaurant so can use the opportunity to sell clothing and perfume to her work mates and customers. In the afternoons she sells the products door to door and as she is well known, this sometimes results in orders too. Narcisa is a very enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.

A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help her buy a variety of perfumes, clothing (shirts, blouses, t-shirts, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear) as well as oil, beans, tortillas, mayo, cheese, lettuce, chicken, beef, chilies, potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and garlic-- the ingredients for the dishes she makes.

Narcisa hopes that her business will continue to prosper so she can improve her standard of living.

The other members of the group are:
Marisol (soft drink sales)
Berenice (beauty salon)
Ignacio (food sales)
Ysidra (corner store)
Aeropajita (lingerie sales)
Rosa Aurora (food sales)
Domingo (footwear sales)
Nelly (seamstress)

loans.use: Buy perfume, clothing, and ingredients for the Mexican food she makes

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Erika es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos clasificados desde hace 5 años y tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña Erika necesita el préstamo para la compra de sandalias, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le es de mucha ayuda, con el préstamo espera incrementar la cantidad de productos de su negocio logrando así que sus ventas aumenten.
Doña Erika espera que gracias al esta inversión poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Ella espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijo tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Erika is a very hard working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. For 5 years she has had a business selling second hand clothing and shoes and runs this from her home in the town where she lives. Erika needs the loan to buy sandals, blouses, trousers, shirts etc. so she can carry on with her work which is a great help to her.

With the loan she hopes to increase the quantity of products in her business and so increase her sales. She hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her own and her family's quality of life a little with the increase in household income. In the short term she hopes to grow her business so she can continue to support her family and so her children can have the necessary education to have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy sandals, blouses, trousers, shirts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar, âgé de 40 ans, est tailleur depuis plus de 10 ans déjà, malheureusement, il n’a pas encore eu la possibilité de travailler avec ses propres moyens. Pour pallier a cela, il s’est rapproché de l’IMCEC pour recevoir un appui financier et pouvoir acheter une cantine et y pratiquer son activité.
Babacar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants dont il a la charge de nourrir et de scolariser. Et c’est grâce aux revenus de son activité, qu’il peut améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires et épargner. Babacar coud des ensembles qu’il expose et revend, il a donc besoin d’agrandir son activité pour produire plus, se faire connaitre et maximiser son profit. C’est là son plus grand rêve, détenir une grande unité de production.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar, age 40, has been a tailor for over 10 years already. Unfortunately, he is still unable to support this business himself. To remedy this problem, he turned to the IMCEC to get a loan that will enable him to buy a shop where he can practice his activity. 

Babacar is married with 3 dependent children. He provides for their needs and their education. He is counting on the income earned through his activity to improve their living conditions and save some money. 

Babacar makes clothes that he displays and sells, and he needs to expand his activity to bolster production, become better known and maximize his profits. His greatest dream is to run a large production facility.

loans.use: to buy a space that he can turn into a sewing shop.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is 26 years old. He describes himself as a hardworking person and has always wanted to be part of a team that empowers and advocates for positive change. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience in information technology which will help him get a job.

In five years time he hopes to be working for a non-governmental organization in an increasingly responsible position that enables him to utilize his talents and work closely with colleagues in solving problems. He gets inspiration from his mother who has lived her life helping and empowering people in the community. He feels that an internship at NetHope will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old and he comes from a loving family of three children. He is passionate about information technology because it improves peoples lives. He has a degree in computer science. He has take a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to acquire skills and experience in computer science, which will help him get a job.

In the next 5 or 10 years he hopes that he will have greatly increased his expertise in IT and secure a good job that will help him provide for those who depend on him. He gets inspiration from his mother who sacrificed so much to get him to where he is today. He faced the challenge of obtaining relevant knowledge and expertise in computer security, but was able to get the information from the internet and various open source projects.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years old and comes from a humble back ground. He has a passion to pursue a career in information technology and enhance his skills in IT. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him gain skills and experience in IT, which will help him get a job.

In 5 years time he sees himself progressing in network administration in an information technology company. He finds the internship extremely interesting and motivating. He expects a lot from the internship, especially hands-on experience that will enable him get a job.

He gets inspiration from his parents who worked so hard to enable him become a better person, and also the fast growing trend of information technology. He is inspired to succeed so as to provide for his siblings and become a role model.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 25 years old and he is enthusiastic about information technology. His passion for IT started when he was young and it has been growing strong. He comes from a community where information technology is beginning to take shape. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain the necessary skills and experience in IT, which will enable him to get a job.

In 10 years time he sees himself as an accomplished IT professional, and would like to own an IT solutions provider firm and be part of a national or global solution to some of the challenges currently facing Africa and the world at large.

He gets inspiration from all accomplished IT professionals who have pioneered and dominated the IT industry amidst the challenges that faced their endeavors. He feels that the cost of IT infrastructure is overwhelming, especially to students as access to genuine hardware and software resources is limited due to high cost. He was able to overcome this challenge by pooling resources with others to procure what he needed.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en: Cherly wants to be an accountant in the future. She is studying for a  BS in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. She has four siblings and her father earns their living through farming. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to cover the costs of school materials for the second semester. In the future, Cherly wants to finish her studies and be able to find a job related to her course.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school materials

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is married and has four children. She operates a general store in the Philippines.

Nita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 1,800 PHP, which she will use to buy a solar lamp so that she can provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Nita is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Adonis, a machinist, and they have children. They both manage their household as they also work for their family. One of their children is in high school and the other one is in grade school.

Rita operates their machine shop. Her husband is the main machinist while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair and check-up of all types of machines. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of appliances. 

Rita hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for machine maintenance and buy other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Octavio Zenón

texts.es: Para la siguiente cosecha Octavio Zenón necesita un crédito que utilizará para el pago de cortadores de café que contratará para que lo ayuden en sus fincas. Desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a la actividad del café y el junto con su familia se encargan de la mayoría de las labores en el campo, sin embargo este año tendrán mucho trabajo así que han decidido contratar personal.
texts.en: For the next harvest, Octavio Zenón needs a loan he will use to pay coffee pickers he will hire to help on his farms. He has been a coffee farmer for many years. He and his family do a majority of the work in the fields, however this year there will be so much work that they have decided to hire workers.

loans.use: to pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning $3 a day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $1 a day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 each a day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Channa is requesting a loan for $350, which she will use to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, Channa would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees. She also wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. She has a huge plantation that covers eight acres of land where she grows taro, bananas, yams and kasava (sweet potatoes) to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years, and is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a chain saw.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. With her profits, Mele hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a chain saw.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta  is a 49-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Jacinta has requested a loan to buy an over-lock sewing machine, thread, needles, and materials. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an over-lock sewing machine, thread, needles, and materials

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a kiva borrower. He describes himself as an aspiring and quality focused IT professional who is ready to utilize his skills in network administration and web development to increase the productivity of a company while at the same time improving the welfare of the society. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years time he intends to further his education and end up as a senator or a governor. He believes he has the opportunity to change his life for the better. This inspires him to work hard and pay attention to the finer details so that he can achieve his goals.

At the university where he was studying, he faced a challenge of not being able to afford three meals a day. Since he was studying information technology he started repairing other students' computers for a fee and was able to afford meals.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 23 years old. He is the second born in a family of five. He lives in a community where information technology is not widely used and that brought a passion to eradicate this mentality in society. He has done a diploma in business information technology. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years he sees himself having an IT firm that caters for all IT related issues. He gets inspiration from his local church. It has inspired him to go the digital way because the largest group in the society is the youth and all are into information technology.

During his lower level education, he failed exams because of lack of seriousness and no university wanted to accommodate him. But after a few lectures from his parents and pastor he became born again and changed his habits and since then he found a university which was ready to accommodate him. He feels that God has blessed him with a chance to expand his IT level though the internship.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is studying Information Technology for a BS at the university in Oroquieta City. Her father earns from employment as a welder while her mother has a buying and selling business. 

This semester, Edna needs financial assistance to  pay school tuition fees for the second semester. She borrowed from the GDMPC education loan product and she is thankful that her needs were settled. In the future, she wants to be successful in her career and able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou  est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans le commerce de  légumes. Astou a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 13h30mn. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et ensuite vendre les légumes dans un marché de la commune. Astou aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Astou quitte sa maison à 9h pour y revenir dans l’après midi vers les environs de 13h 30mn. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier son activité en exploitant son ferme agricole, ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Ms. Astou is a married mother with a family. She does commerce in vegetables and has over fifteen years of experience in this business. She starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 1:30 PM. She is requesting this amount of money to purchase and then sell vegetables at a commune market. Astou helps her husband in managing day-to-day family expenses and the children's schooling costs. For the future, she would like to diversify her business by making use of her farm. Thus, she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items and products for her variety store. She had this store for seven years now, and it continues to grow. Her income from the business supported their everyday needs at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merly hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams to give her children a good future. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She has been able to grow her dogs well and the profit was good. The loan also helped in the education of her children who are all in grade school. Her income from the business supported their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy dog food and pay for their grooming. Her profits from business will definitely help her support her family's everyday needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rona hopes that she can maintain her business and dreams of giving her family a better living. She attends the weekly fellowship group* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy dog food and pay for their grooming.

loans.name: Procy

texts.en:
Procy is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Procy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

Procy has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Procy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising water buffalo in the Philippines. Elenita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional water buffalo to raise.

Elenita has been raising water buffalo for 6 years, and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional water buffalo to raise.

loans.name: Urufunguruzo Group

texts.fr:
Emile  fait partie du groupe  Urupfunguruzo et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 44 et est marié à Emelyne. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 6 à 10 ans,tous etudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une maison, une moto pour son déplacement acheter  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emile is part of the group Urupfunguruzo and lives in Bubanza. He is 44 years old and married to Emelyne. Together they have three children from 6 to 10 years old, all in school. 

Emile has been doing commerce in clothing for seven years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a house, buy a motorbike as transportation, and sees his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 43 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animal for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $5 daily. 

Due to the lack of funds, Phally is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. This purchase will help provide a hygienic place for cooking. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Laihour

texts.en:
Laihour is 23 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband works as a soldier who earns about $3 per day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Laihour is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the family’s transportation expenses and help her husband easily go to work. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. She has a small taxi service business. She has been in business for five years.
