This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva, in order to excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle and to buy corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Kandoro Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her mid 20s, has one daughter who goes to school.  She has been running a business of selling 'bites' like chapati, mandazi and samosas for two years now. She works from 6.00 am to 12 noon (for six hours only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her stock of baking flour, cooking oil, charcoal, Irish potatoes, onions and carrots.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and for household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal to make more 'bites' to sell to more people.  She dreams of owning a restaurant.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "KANDORO" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal for making more 'bites' to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Perla se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Perla trabaja en un centro textil de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Perla se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará los materiales de estudios que necesita que necesita, como separatas, libros, folletos y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Perla is a 21-year-old woman, she is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic and devotes all her efforts to getting ahead. Thanks to her efforts and the help of her parents, Perla is studying a professional career.

On her own initiative, Perla works in a tailor's shop in her city. She works for approximately eight hours each day and she thinks she is doing well because of her dedication and good performance.

Perla is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will buy the study materials she needs, like printouts, books, brochures, and more, so that she can continue to work and to strive to achieve her dream of becoming a working professional.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en: Phung would like to take a further loan to buy materials for making plastic laminated items. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora de 25 años de edad, soltera y sin ninguna dependencia (Hijos) con un grado educativo de secundaria cursando el plan básico en su totalidad la cual aún vive con sus padres y hermanos. Sonia se dedica a la agricultura ya que en su familia es una tradición especializándose en la caficultura y la elaboración de viveros desde hace más de 10 años siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos, intermediarios que llegan a la zona y demás. Sus cultivos de café se encuentran ubicados a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación  al cual se trasladan en autobús en compañía de sus hermanos y sus padres para poder asistir la plantación y vivero ya que como una familia dedicada a la caficultura se involucran todos en este rubro.  
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos de café sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad y de esta forma poder obtener mayores ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Pero su más grande anhelo es seguir estudiando poder ingresar a la universidad y preparase académicamente en una carrera que pueda implementar en lo que ella mejor hace y poder llevar mejores y nuevas técnicas o estrategias para seguir creciendo
Por lo que ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así poder dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café comprando abono, fertilizantes, foliares, urea, entre otros y poder empezar a dar paso a su más grande sueño mediante las ganancias obtenidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a young, persistent and enterprising woman. She is 25 years old, single and has no children. She finished high school, reaching a basic level of education. She still lives with her parents and siblings.

Sonia works in agriculture, which is a tradition in her family. She specializes in growing coffee and building greenhouses and has been doing so for more than ten years. Her clients are neighbors and friends, middle men, etc. Her coffee plantations are located five km [around three miles] from where she lives, so she, her siblings and her parents take a bus and work together growing coffee.

Her dream is to expand her plantations in the future in order to produce more and receive a higher income to get ahead with her family. However, her biggest dream is to continue studying and make it to the university, so she can have a professional carrier. This way, she could apply her knowledge doing what she does best and would be able to bring the best practices and the newest techniques and strategies to continue growing.

For this, she needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to take care of her coffee plantations. She will buy compost, fertilizers, foliar spray, urea and other supplies she needs. With the profits she will make, she will take the first step towards the fulfillment of her biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Zhidmad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhidmad está  formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia Zhidmad en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de mucha vegetación, de verdes campos y hermosos paisajes, lugar que permite disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad del campo. Todos sus habitantes al igual que las socias son personas que luchan muy duro para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y así brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, trabajan en la agricultura y crianza de animales y muchos laboran a diario en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas
Una de las socias de este grupo es Señora. Purificación, es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Zhidmad, le gusta pertenecer a este grupo de cerdito por la unión y solidaridad que existe entre todas sus compañeras.
La Señora Purificación tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad  que están casados y viven independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Ella se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos, caballos y ganado del cual obtiene la leche, con la leche realiza quesos y los vende en la ciudad.  También labora en la agricultura que es para su consumo y para la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en abono y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es  crecer en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “Zhidmad” is composed of ten women that live close to Zhidmad, a village in Cuenca. This area is surrounded by vegetation, green fields and beautiful landscapes, and it is a place where it is possible to enjoy the peaceful and quiet countryside. 

The group’s members and the rest of the inhabitants work hard to keep the stability at home and give their children a better future. They all work in agriculture and raise animals. Many of them work every day in the city, performing different economic activities.

One of the members is Purificación. She is one of the founding members of this group. She likes to be part of this group because the members have a close relationship and help each other. Purificación is 64 years old, married, and has four children who are adults now, married and live independently. Her husband works in agriculture and they live together in a house they own. She raises guinea pigs, pigs, horses and dairy cattle. With the milk, she makes cheese to sell in the city. She also works in agriculture, growing vegetables for her own consumption and to sell.

Purificación is requesting a loan to buy compost and animal feed. Her goal is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy compost and animal feed.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined and confident. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea for sale. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to clean water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have access to clean water. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy water storage equipment

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica  is 43 years old, widowed  and she provides for eight members of her family. She has been in the tea-selling business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs.5,000. She operates her business in Chemundu center and is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. She has borrowed Ksh.15,000 and plans to use part of it to purchase tea leaves for sale and the rest to improve her daily farming activities. She will use the profits from the milk trade to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: To buy tea leaves for sale and improve her daily farming activities

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 29 years old, married to Joseph, and together they are blessed with five children.

She has a boutique business in Naivasha which she has been running for seven years, and she has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase a stock of clothes for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business and pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest boutique in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien would like to take a further loan to buy plastic materials to increase her production of laminated items. Tien's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials to use for laminating.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 64 years old and married with six children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid twenty-three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and she earns additional income from raising ducks.

Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, etc for her tailoring business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, etc

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Gyumri town with her two children, 9 and 1 year old. The only source of family income comes from cosmetology services that she has been providing for the last five years. Due to her tireless work, Marine manages to provide her small family with normal living conditions. She receives her clients at home and provides different types of cosmetology services. 

Now, in order to be able to enlarge the service that she provides, Marine needs financial support. She has applied for this loan and currently has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will greatly assist Marine to purchase tools and materials and she will be able to provide wider range of services to her clients.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing cosmetology services

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong would like to take a further loan to buy more materials to increase her production of candles. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce candles.

loans.name: Gakhraman

texts.en:
Gakhraman is a 58-year-old married man. He lives with his son and wife in a small village of Marneuli district. His son works as a physical worker and gets a maximum of 500 GEL per month. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and a calf. Their milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Gakhraman has a plot of agricultural land, where cabbages and tomatoes are grown. 

He is a very hard-working man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He always has high quality produce, which is sold to local retailers. Gakhraman decided to purchase a tractor and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $5000 for purchasing a tractor. When the tractor is purchased, Gakraman will cultivate his land properly and he will also rent it out to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married and has five children. She operates a poultry business selling chickens and eggs, which sShe has been doing for 10 years. She describes her challenge to be the lack of water storage facility. 

Rosemary is requesting a loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a water storage facility and a stock of hens.

loans.use: to purchase a water storage facility and a stock of hens

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
Chanh would like to take a further loan to buy good quality ingredients to make dumplings to sell from her stall. 

Chanh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients to make dumplings.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh would like to take a further loan to buy more furniture for renting. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for renting.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen would like to take a further loan to buy more gas tanks to sell from her stall. 

Xuyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of gas tanks to sell.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My, 53, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

My has been running a general store in front of her door for eight years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

My is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 52, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a welder. 

Anh started a shop of iron welding 13 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of iron to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business of iron welding.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is 30 years old, and lives in the town of Iganga in a region of Uganda. She is married and has two children.  One of them is currently in school.  For the past four years, Aziza has been working hard to manage her salon service, which does hair dressing and sells bags.  

To help expand her business, Aziza has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a hair dryer and more bags, and will help Aziza to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for the children and expand the business. 

Aziza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aziza, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and more bags.

loans.name: Josephe

texts.en:
Josephe is 46 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Josephe has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food stuffs. 

To help expand his business, Josephe has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase more food stuffs such as bread and milk to sell, and will help Josephe generate greater profits. It's his first loan and has no impact as yet. Josephe hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock whenever it's needed. 

Josephe is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephe who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase more food stuffs such as bread and milk to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho, in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Eric has been working hard to manage his charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Eric has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal to sell, and will help Eric to generate greater profits and expand the business. Eric hopes that in the future, he will be able to have enough supplies in order to make more profits. 

Eric is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eric who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is single in her late 20s, has been managing her life by running two businesses. She is involved with stationery as her big business and also food selling like chips mayai (a local potato omelette) with fried meat. She also does catering services if she has orders. She works from 8:00 a.m. to midnight if she has catering service. Magdalena is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Magdalena will use this loan to improve her food business by increasing the type of food she cooks. She is doing great on her businesses but she is looking for your financial support to meet her target. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her businesses with success. 

Magdalena will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Ulunguru," which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her food business by increasing type of food cooking.

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena is 19 years old and single. She lives with her parents and other siblings in a rural village of Prasat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. Leakena is a year-one student at the University of South-East Asia in the province. Her major is accounting, the major that she loves and thinks is suitable for her personality. Her education fees are subsidized by her parents. In order to help her parents cover her tuition fees, during her course Leakena has a part-time job in Snow Yogurt at Lucky Mall. 

Due to the family’s financial constraints, Leakena is experiencing difficulties covering her education fees, so she decided to take out a loan in the amount of 1,575 US dollars, which will enable her to cover the overall fees for the rest of her three-year courses at the university. Leakena is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher education, and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover the overall fees for the rest of her three-year courses at the university.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. Diosdada is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Diosdada requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 36 years old, married and provides for seven members of her family. 

She has been in the milk-selling business but also has a cabbages farm. She has run her agriculture business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has borrowed KES 20,000 and plans to use it to purchase more milk for resale as well as improve on farming cabbages. She will use the profits from the milk trade to invest in dairy farming. Her dream is to invest in cash crops like tea.

loans.use: To buy milk for sale as well as improve her cabbages farming business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising carabao (water buffalo). 

Edna is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing for her buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 52-year-old industrious lady. She is married to Solomon. She is a mother of a 19-year-old child. Elizabeth has run a grocery store in Narok for the last two years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings]. She learned about about Kadet Ltd. from other women in the market who are already being funded by Kadet.

Elizabeth has being advanced a second loan of 47,079 KES, which will facilitate her in the purchase of a water tank. This will go a great mile in assisting the family with water storage in an area where the commodity is very scarce.

Elizabeth's dream is to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en:
Uyen is 37 years old, is married and has a son. Her husband is a security guard. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Uyen has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children.  

Uyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 19 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

Jessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, bread, chips, etc.

Jessa has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Jessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 53, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two sons, one daughter and her husband. Her husband earns money through his service of vehicle repairing. Hai is running a shop, selling sugarcane juice. She started this business seven years ago. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of sugarcane to increase her sales. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy and sell sugarcane juice.

loans.name: Nho

texts.en:
Nho, 60, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. She and her husband have earned money through their business of running a cafe. She started this business eight years ago. 

She would like to get a loan to buy food, soft drinks and coffee to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food, soft drinks and coffee.

loans.name: Seiran

texts.en:
Seiran is 30-year-old young man from the small village of Marneuli district. He lives with his 53-year-old mother, who is housekeeper. He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Seiran was unable to study for a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing different kinds of vegetables and walnut trees. Harvested vegetables are used in the family and walnuts are sold to local retailers. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Seiran decided to start own business and sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempt was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL [Georgia lari] to start trading fruits and vegetables. Seiran will purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and resell at a higher price to generate income. He is very motivated to be involved in his own business and help his mother to cover everyday expenses.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marnely

texts.en:
Marnely is 48 years old and married, with five children.

Marnely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell, like sugar, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

Marnely has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for nine years, and she also earns an income from raisings pigs.

Marnely aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell, like sugar, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the region of Uganda. She has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Susan has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more new clothes to sell. It will help Susan to generate greater profits and be able to pay school fees for her children. Susan hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a new business and complete her unfinished house. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Susan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es:
Luz Adilia de 60 años de edad. Madre soltera con dos nietos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Ella se ha caracteriza por ser emprendedora, trabajadora, para tener un medio de trabajo digno. Esta señora desde muy ha luchado en la vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y en la actualidad sigue luchado por el porvenir de sus pequeños nietos.

Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la elaboración de trabajos manuales flores plasticas y de fomi El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Su  rutina de  trabajo es 8 horas  ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de materia prima como es plasticos, pegas, papellis, fomi alambre, pintura  Luz Adilia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luz Adilia is 60 years old.  She is a single mother and has two grandchildren in her care.  Luz is originally from Sauce, in the north of Nicaragua.  She is hard-working responsible and wants to do better in life.  Luz has had to be enterprising and hard-working in order to have a decent job.  Luz has fought hard in life to get ahead with her children and she is now fighting for her young grandchildren's futures.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Luz makes a living making hand-made plastic and foam flowers.  She runs the business out of her home and works eight hours per day, selling her products.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital for her business, buying basic materials such as plastic, glue, paper, foam, and paint.  Luz is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping poor countries such as a Nicaragua and for helping people with very little money to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her business, buying basic materials such as plastic, glue, paper, foam, and paint for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Cintya Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cintya es una mujer de 30 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Cintya no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Cintya trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y adornos navideños, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Cintya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, tanto prendas de vestir como adornos para la campaña navideña, así pues Cintya seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena comerciante.
texts.en:
Cintya is 30 years old, single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  Cintya is very hard-working, enthusiastic, and dedicates all her efforts to trying to prosper.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because she needed to work, Cintya was unable to study at university.

Through her own initiative, Cintya works at her own business, selling clothes and Christmas decorations.  She works every day for around ten hours a day.  She thinks the work is going well because she is dedicated and is friendly with her customers.

Cintya is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, she will be able to buy more merchandise, both clothing items and Christmas decorations. Then Cintya can continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her big dream of being a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
dúo Amanecer de San Miguel 
Este dúo esta conformado por Miriam Alicia ella tiene 45 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chocolate,en la aldea de San miguel y ella entrega sus pedidos en la Antigua Guatemala,y parte de Chimaltenango,y Magdalena Milpas Altas, ella desde ya hace 10 años elabora con muchca delicadesa este sabroso chocolate por esa razon solicita este credito porque estos son los meses que ella tiene que prepararse con suficiente producto y surtir a sus clientes en diferentes diceños y tamaños en chocolate, su deseo es seguir creciendo y mejorar cada vez su producto ya que de esa forma ayuda a sus familia con el ingreso de su hogar.
texts.en:
The "Amanecer de San Miguel" Duo

One member of this duo is Miriam Alicia.  She is 45 years old and makes a living making and selling chocolate in San Miguel village.  She delivers orders to Antigua Guatemala and part of Chimaltenango and Magdalena Milpas Altas.  Miriam has been delicately producing this delicious chocolate for ten years.  She is now applying for a loan as it is at this time of year that she must prepare enough to sell and stock up so that Miriam can sell customers chocolates of different designs and sizes.  Miriam's wish is to keep growing and to keep improving her product.  With this she can help her family by bringing home an income.

loans.use: to buy cacao and sugar to make and sell chocolate.

loans.name: Ana Joaquina

texts.es: Ana Joaquina se encuentra muy feliz y muy agradecida con Dios por todas las bendiciones brindadas, ya que con su primer financiamiento pudo comprar insumos agrícolas con los que pudieron asistir tres tareas de tierra pudiendo también sembrar semilla certificada para seguir agrandando más sus cultivos. Gracias a las compras de insumos que hizo ella pudo sacarle provecho a 35 quintales de papa las cuales vendió a muy buen precio obteniendo un ingreso factible con el cual pudo salir de su compromiso. De la utilidad obtenida ella compro nuevamente semilla para volver a cultivar además pudo comprar una parte de fertilizantes una pequeña siembra de café que tiene cultivada y poder generar más ingresos de esa cosecha al final de la temporada. Su primer financiamiento fue de mucha ayuda para que ella pudiese cumplir con sus metas y seguir trabajando de forma que hoy en día ella solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual comprara otra parte de insumos y podrá preparar parte de la tierra que aún no tiene lista para cultivar el nuevo semillero abonando la misma.
texts.en:
Ana Joaquina is very pleased and appreciates all of the blessings that God has provided. Her first loan was used to buy farming supplies so that she can tend to three plots of land. She also bought certified seed that allowed her to continue expanding her crops. Thanks to the purchase of these supplies, Ana was able to produce 35 quintals (1 quintal = 100 kg) of potatoes that were sold at a very good price. The income she earned made it possible for her to fulfill her commitments.

Her profits were also used to buy more seed so that she could replant. In addition, she bought fertilizer for a small plot of coffee that she is cultivating so that she can earn additional income from that harvest at the end of the season. Ana's first loan was of great help since she was be able to complete her goals and continue working in the same manner as she always has.

She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy farming supplies in order to prepare part of her land that is not ready for cultivation. As a result, she will be able to plant a new seedbed.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 25 years old. He comes from a humble background and his parents are small scale farmers. He has always wanted to pursue a course in information technology. He has done a degree in computer engineering. He will use the loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at Nethope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience which will enable him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years he wants to have his own IT firm where he will be offering consultancy services to clients to enable them achieve their IT goals with ease. The internship will equip him with the necessary technical and soft skills, which will enhance his IT skills.

He is inspired by the need to transform society so that information technology is fully utilized.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is aged 42, married, and blessed with five children. She has been in the hog-raising business for almost twenty-five years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP per hog. She also operates a food production business to generate more income. Her profits were spent on their food allowances and electric bill. 

Due to lack of capital to continue her business, she decided to request a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue improving and earning more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 41 años, está casado, Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad, es el que genera los ingresos para que su familia cuente con alimentación, educación y salud de calidad, es un oficio que aprendió de su padre cuando era un niño, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado, de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m. Desde que el ejerce esta actividad económica no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderla.
Comprará herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y pagara mano de obra que le ayuden a sembrar, como resultado espera mejores ingresos y una cosecha abundante.
Mejorar su situación económica para ofrecerles a sus hijos un apoyo constante en su desarrollo académico, crecer en su negocio y salir de deudas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 9 and 5. The income he generates is used for his family so that they can have food, education, and good health. Pedro learned his trade when he was a boy and was instructed by his father. His work schedule is Monday through Saturday, from 6:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. Ever since he started in this line of work, Pedro has not had to contend with any problems.

He will buy herbicides, fungicides, compost, and also pay for workers to help with the planting. As a result, he hopes to improve his income and achieve an abundant harvest. This will improve his financial situation so that he can provide his children the constant support that they need to develop academically. He will also be able to grow his business and pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fungicides, compost, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en:
Bassima, a 47-year-old married mother of two, has operated an art business for the past 13 years, specializing in embroidery work. She started working on her own to help her husband earn their living and cover their expenses. A hardworking woman with a very good reputation, Bassima is well known in her region for her special talent, quality and prices.

Bassima is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to perform necessary maintenance to her kitchen before the coming winter season. She is working hard to open a special embroidery workshop where she can recruit ladies who can help her in increasing her production and improving her living.

loans.use: To perform necessary maintenance to her kitchen before the coming winter season

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a man of thirty-six years, married to Lucy and a father of three children. He sells used clothes in Kangemi and has been in this business for five years. Paul gets a monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Paul's first loan with Kadet LTD. He plans to use the entire amount to buy clothes for sale. In the future, he wants to be prosperous in business and also to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old and very hard-working man, married to Jane. He is the father of two boys, aged thirteen and nine years respectively. He has been buying and selling clothing in Narok town for the last seventeen years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

James learned about Kadet from other business colleagues who are already accessing Kadet's financial services. He has been advanced a second loan of KES 50,000 after successfully paying off the previous one, and will use the funds to buy more clothing for resale now that he has a busy stall.

James will use the proceeds from the business to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand the business to a highly profitable venture.

loans.use: purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Nico

texts.en:
Nico is 26 years old. His passion for technology started way back when he was in primary school. He has a degree in information technology from a local university and he is on the path to finding a job and finally helping his community. He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. 

This will enable him to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will enable him get a job. In 5 or 10 years time he sees himself in a position to start a project that will help children from his community to embrace technology from an early stage.

The desire to succeed and practice what he has learnt over the years inspires him to bring positive change to the community. He believes that technology is the solution to most problems in Africa.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 57 years old, married, and has 10 children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns additional income from selling food.

Merlita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kazdo

texts.en:
Kazdo is a hardworking and enterprising woman from the coastal region of Kenya. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 31 years old and engaged to be married. She has two young girls, ages 6 and 9. She has been operating her Zoona mobile money business since 2011. This will be Angela’s third loan. 

Angela’s business has come a long way since 2012. Back then, she was struggling to serve customers because of a lack of working capital. She was not making enough money to care for her children, who were living 9 hours away in Lusaka with their grandmother. 

Then Angela received her first Kiva loan. This solved her working capital problem, and she was able to serve more customers and earn more income. This allowed her to bring her children home to Solwezi which made her very happy. Presently, Angela’s business has grown and become more successful. She has set up three additional outlets and employs six people to help with her business. This makes her very happy to have a positive impact in her community by providing a good service as well as jobs. 

Angela’s third loan will help her to continue to scale her business. She will be able to operate her outlets more efficiently with the additional capital to service customers. She explains how the growth in her business has translated into more people in the community visiting her shops for money transfers. This increased demand is good but requires her to have more capital to service the need. 

Angela’s biggest dream is to one day build her own house and see her young kids get a good education that will open up many opportunities for them. She is hopeful this dream will become reality through her growing business.

loans.use: To fund her existing mobile money shops and serve customers in need of financial services more efficiently

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a son and her husband. She and her husband earn money through their business which is producing deodorant and cleaning products. She has been in this business for four years. 

Huong would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of raw material to increase her production of deodorant and cleaning products. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make deodorant and cleaning products

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, 40, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his two children and his wife. Tien and his wife have earned money by running a food stall in front of their house for 10 years. 

Tien is requesting a loan to buy a larger stock of food and ingredients to make meals to better satisfy his customers' needs. He also hopes his business will ensure that his family, especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy food and other ingredients to make meals to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en:
Hoai, 35, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including two children and his wife. His wife supports the family by running a cafe. Hoai manages a shop that repairs and sells computer components. 

He would like to get a loan to buy better-quality computer components to meet his customers' needs. 

Hoai hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy computer components.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his  two sons, three daughters and his wife. Tuyen and his wife earn money through their business selling food in front of their house, an enterprise they started four years ago. 

Tuyen is requesting a loan to buy food such as noodles, pork, beef and breads to better satisfy his customers. He also hopes his business will ensure that his family, especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, pork, beef and breads to sell at his food stall.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 52, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and her husband. Her husband works as a painter, while she has managed a cafe at her house for 10 years. Now requesting a loan to buy better quality coffee and food to serve her customers, Mai hopes her business will ensure that her family members  have a better future.

loans.use: to buy better quality coffee and food to serve her customers

loans.name: Misozi

texts.en:
23-year-old Misozi has been running her Zoona mobile money transfer business for over a year now. She works hard to support her family as well as her studies in school. This is Misozi’s third loan from Kiva.

Misozi started her business with one shop located on a busy street in downtown Lusaka. Today she operates five shops located throughout some of Lusaka’s bussiest areas. She has 12 employees working at her five shops.  Misozi credits her success to the financial assistance that she has received from Kiva saying, “With Zoona and Kiva, I have opened up five outlets. I love Zoona and Kiva because they give me a platform to interact with people from different sectors of the community, and I feel proud knowing I am providing a valuable service  to people. Zoona and Kiva have opened many doors for me as an entrepreneur; my income has provided for my education and my family.”

Misozi is requesting a third  Kiva loan so she can boost her working capital in two of her shops that struggle with maintaining sufficient funds to service customers who need access to financial services.  She is hopeful the loan will increase the turnover at the two shops. The profits will  help her to continue pursuing a degree in accounting and to care for her family's needs.

loans.use: To improve the service at two of her shops which struggle with maintaining sufficient funds to service customers who need access to financial services.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old Micro-entrepreneur.  He operates a mobile money business that serves the needs of his community by providing financial services.  He is requesting a loan to grow his business so he can serve more customers.  Paul sent this update to be used on his new Kiva profile.  

In my request for another loan I would like to let lenders know my past two loans have enabled me to expand from one shop to four in my town of Kabwe.  Now, I am able to serve many more customers.  This is good for customers as well as me because I am earning more income.  

My personal life has improved with this business growth as well.  I am able to manage my home and I can assist with needs that arise for my relatives.  

My third loan will be used to expand my business by opening a fifth shop in Kabwe.  I have seen the need for another shop with customer demand.  Many people enjoy the service of being able to easily send and receive money.  

In conclusion, I would like to thank lenders for believing in me and allowing me to grow my business and improve my life through access to capital.

loans.use: to expand his business by opening another shop in Kabwe town.

loans.name: Clemente Jesús

texts.es: Clemente Jesús se ha dedicado a la producción de café desde hace más de 20 años y fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo relacionado con esta actividad. Es socio de la "Unión Regional" y allí entrega toda su producción que es de la mejor calidad. Para esta cosecha solicita un crédito que utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de cortadores de café que contratará y pagará este financiamiento al final de la cosecha
texts.en:
Clemente Jesús has been producing coffee for more than 20 years. His father taught him everything related to his line of work. Clemente is a member of Union Regional de Huatusco and delivers everything he produces there since his crops are of the best quality.

For this harvest season, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and pay the coffee pruners that he will hire. Clemente will repay this loan at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for coffee pruners.

loans.name: Abimael

texts.es: Abimael vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su familia y es considerado como una persona   trabajadora y responsable, él se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Girasoles” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como patos y gallinas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicado en distrito de la Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Abimael lives in the city of Pilcopata with his family and is considered to be a hardworking and responsible person.  He works in farming and raising small animals.  He has had this business for several years and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it.

Abimael belongs to the communal bank "Los Girasoles" (The Sunflowers).  At this time, he is in need of a loan to buy small farm animals such as ducks and chickens.  He is thankful for and values this loan and promises to make his monthly payments with diligence.

The city of Pilcopata is located in the Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: buy small farm animals such as ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a lady 29 years old and married to Paul. She is the mother of two children.

Alice runs a pharmacy in Uthiru in the outskirts of Kangemi.  She has been in this  business for six years now and gets monthly income of sixteen thousand shillings.

This will be Alice's first loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire amount to buy more medicines for her business.  

In the future she wants to open a wholesale pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 46, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rogeric, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household as they both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria makes and sells steamed rice cakes, foods that are commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meals for desserts. She sells them by the order, and they are in particularly high demand on special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1,500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Gloria is requesting a Php35,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings. 

Gloria dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, each fellowship group gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed in making steamed rice cakes.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Lanie requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, threads, etc. for her business.

Lanie has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and she also earns income from clothing sales. 

Ninfa is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, who is 60 years old, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. 

She has earned money through running a cafe. She started this business 20 years ago. 

She would like to get a loan to buy food, soft drinks, and coffee to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food, soft drinks, and coffee for her cafe

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, who is 50 years old, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband is a worker for a construction company. 

She has earned money through selling frozen water, soft drinks, and coconut. She started this business 10 years ago. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks to sell. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, who is 30 years old, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband supports the family by welding iron. 

Trang manages a shop providing internet services and computer games. She would like to get a loan to buy better-quality computer components to meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy computer components for her internet shop

loans.name: Dien

texts.en:
Dien, who is 54 years old, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including five children and her husband. Her husband is running a shop of internet services.

Dien has earned money through running a cafe. She started this business 15 years ago. 

She would like to get a loan to buy food, soft drinks, and coffee to meet her customers' needs. 

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food, soft drinks, and coffee for her cafe

loans.name: Martin Alexander

texts.es: Martin  vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su familia y es considerado como una persona   trabajadora y responsable, él se dedica a la elaboración de panes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Girasoles” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicado en distrito de la Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Martin lives in the city of Pilcopata with his family and has for several years earned a living baking bread (Pilcopata is located in the Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Peru). 

Martin has earned a reputation for hard work and trustworthiness and, thanks his efforts, belongs to the Las Girasoles" [Sunflowers] Communal Bank. Martin is applying for a loan to purchase supplies, such as sacks of flour. He is grateful for the loan and appreciates how it will help his business, so he is committed to making monthly payments in full and on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as sacks of flour.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 23 year old, a young lad employed in the motorcycle transport business. 

He has been in this business for a  year in Narok town, earning a monthly income of KES 26,000. He learned about Kadet from other riders in towm who are already being financed by Kadet Ltd.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 87,880, which he will use to purchase his own motorcycle. He will use the proceeds to cater for his basic needs as well as to repay his loan. 

His dream is to expand his business to greater heights.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old and married, with three children. She describes herself to be focused and honest. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells bread, flour, and materials. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that some customers take goods on credit and fail to pay. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and add stocks of bread, flour, and other materials to sell in her shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and add stocks of bread, flour, and other materials for her store

loans.name: Katwekamu Tukore Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). She operates a retail shop located in a rural area in Rwentondo – Rukungiri District. She has been doing this business for the past 16 years. 

She is married, with seven children, and she gets support from her husband in doing business. She supplements her business with income from cattle rearing and crop husbandry.

She is a hard-working woman, and now she has acquired a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more items for daily household use to add to her shop.

She expects to make profits from the money borrowed so that she can give a good education to her children. She is a member of Katwe Kamwe Tokore Group, and the whole group has been supportive in helping each other grow.

loans.use: To buy more items for daily household use to add to her shop

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and married with six children. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, bath soap, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for four years, and she sells a great variety of items at her store. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks, like canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioners, bath soap, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hard-working woman who lives at the coastal region of Kenya.

Nelly has operated a stall selling fruits and vegetable for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: G.s. Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El g.s. Ríos de Agua está conformado por tres mujeres, madres responsables de siete hijos, son originaria de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Nagarote se caracteriza por su comida típica como el quesillos. Este se grupo son personas, trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar una carrera, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar para ayudar con los gasto de su hogar. En la actualidad lucha para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a sus esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Elsa y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, que es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, fósforos, hielos, tiste, cuajas, crema, aceite, cigarrillos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Ríos de Agua Viva agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Ríos de Agua [River of Waters] Solidarity Group consists of three women who are the mothers of seven children. The members are from Nagarote in western Nicaragua, an area known for its typical cuisines, such as quesillos (cheese-filled tortillas). These three women are hardworking and trustworthy, with a strong desire to succeed. Unfortunately, a lack of financial resources meant that they could not pursue an education, so the members had to work to support their households. They are currently striving to provide their children a better future.  

Elsa is the group's coordinator, thanks to her efforts and ambitions to improve her life. She runs a small grocery store that sells small amounts of foods and other goods: sugar, milk bread, eggs, matches, ice cream, tiste, cuaja [a local cheese], cream, oil, cigarettes, juices, and sodas. Elsa works at the store 12 hours a day, every day. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and purchase foods and other goods for the business, which will boost income in the short term. The members of the Ríos de Agua Solidarity Group are grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to those with few financial resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that people there can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and purchase foods and other goods for her business: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, juice, sodas, matches, and tiste [a sweet regional drink].

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es:
Alberto José de 36 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. El se caracteriza por ser emprendedor, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. A pesar de la crisis económica el lucha por seguir adelante con su pequeño negocio y brindarles la estabilidad, seguridad que su familia necesita.

Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, sal, fósforos, verduras, jugos,gaseogas, huevos, queso. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Alberto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alberto José is 36 years old, married with two children. He is a native of Leon, a city located in the west of the country. He is enterprising, responsible and has the desire to get ahead. In spite of the economic crisis he struggles to continue forward with his small business and provide his family with the security and stability that it needs. 

Thanks to his efforts, and desire to get ahead he has a small grocery store located in his house. He sells consumables like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, salt, matches, vegetables, juices, soft drinks, eggs and cheese. He spends 12 hours per day selling his goods.

The objective of the loan is to invest it in working capital, stocking his store with consumables so that in the near future he can generate more revenue. Alberto is grateful for the assistance offered by the lenders at Kiva to people of low income in poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the opportunity to have dignified employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock his store buying and selling consumables like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, salt, matches, vegetables, juices, soft drinks, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 47 years of age and widowed. She has three children living with her in Prey Kabbas district, Takeo province. 

To be able to fulfill her family’s needs, Saroeun is involved in the cultivation of rice on her own farmland of one hectare. She sells the agricultural products in the local market. Saroeun’s daughter helps her earn the income by weaving women’s skirts made of fine silk with gold and silver decorations.

Currently, Saroeun’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of USD 1,500 to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. 

The water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate has encouraged her to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is one of the smart members of her family who live happily but poorly. She is 51 years old and has a lovely husband who helps her with business. They bring up a daughter. Farida and her husband try to provide their family with the high quality of living conditions. 

With this aim, eight years ago she began her own business selling "‘kuraga" (sun-dried apricots).  She sells kuraga to local people in the local market. 

Nowadays, she has not gotten a good income from her business. She must to buy a stove and coal for the winter season, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of TJS 2,500. 

She will happy if you support her.

loans.use: To buy a stove and coal for the winter season

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos,ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ana se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Ana trabaja como asistente administrativo en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará la compra de sus materiales de estudios como folletos, separatas, libros y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is a 21-year-old woman, is single, and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  She is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and has a great desire to progress.  Thanks to the effort and support of her parents, Ana is currently studying so as to enter a professional career.

Through her own initiative, Ana found a job as an administrative assistant for a retail business in her city.  She works every day for about 8 hours and thinks that it is going well for her due to her dedication and effort.

Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered her she will be able to buy school supplies such as booklets, folders, books, and other things.  In this way, she will continue to work and strive to accomplish her great dream of becoming a skilled professional.

loans.use: buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jocesito De Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Josecito de Cumbe está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por un sector de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado por montañas, se puede admirar la belleza de sus campos y sus tierras son fértiles, su centro parroquial es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su genta al igual que todas las socias son personas amables quienes laboran en la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades como el comercio, limpieza de hogares, trabajo que les da la oportunidad de superarse y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa Elvira, forma parte del grupo de crédito Josecito de Cumbe desde hace 5 años, le gusta estar en este hermoso grupo por la solidaridad y compañerismo que existe entre todas sus vecinas y amigas, a mas que las charlas de educación les ayudan en su vida diaria.
La Señora Rosa Elvira tiene 74 años de edad, es una mujer viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosa Elvira desde muy joven se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y en especial de ganado del cual vende la leche, la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta. Con estas fuentes de ingresos ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 
El dinero de su crédito es para compra una vaca lechera y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animales y continuar con este negocio que ama tanto.
texts.en:
The "Josecito de Cumbe" group is made up of 8 women who live in part of the Cumbe parish in the city of Cuenca.  This area is surrounded by mountains where one can admire the beauty of its fields.  It's land is fertile and the parish center is a mix of ancient and modern sights.  Its people are friendly and mostly work in farming and raising animals.  In addition, many work in the city doing things such as sales, house cleaning, and other work that gives them the opportunity to get ahead.  It offers them a better future for their families.

Rosa is a member of this group and has been a member for 5 years.  She likes being a member of this great group due to the solidarity and companionship that exists among her neighbors and friends who are also members.  In addition, the educational discussions that they take part in help her in her daily life.

Rosa Elvira is 74 years old and is a widow.  With her late husband, however, she conceived 7 children who are all grown, married, and live independently.  She owns the house where she lives.

Rosa Elvira has worked raising guinea pigs, pigs, and especially milk cows since she was very young.  She uses her animals for food and also to sell.  With this source of income, she has been able to help her family get ahead.

The funds gained from this loan will be used to buy a milk cow and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to have more animals and continue with her business that she loves so much.

loans.use: buy a milk cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 27 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jose no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para su venta, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jose is a 27 year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic and he has a strong desire to succeed.  Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jose was not able to study for a professional degree.  On his own initiative, he works in his own small business selling clothing for men, women and children.  He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that the business is doing well because of his dedication and efforts.

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing he will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of garments to sell.  This way, he can continue to work and exert himself so that he can achieve his greatest dream: to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 23 years old and hard-working, a gentleman employed in the motorcycle transport business. John learnt about Kadet from fellow riders in town who are registered members of Kadet Ltd and are already being funded.

John earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has been advanced a first loan of KES 87,880 that will help him in purchasing his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more income that comes with the flexibility of ownership and his already-established customer base.

John plans to use the proceeds to acquire more motorcycles. His dream is to own a public transport vehicle

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 24 years old and a hard-working gentleman. He is employed in the motorcycle transport sector. He supports his aging parents. Samuel learned about Kadet from fellow riders in town who are registered members of Kadet Ltd and are already being serviced with helpful loans.

Samuel earns a basic salary of KES 36,000 in a good month. He has been advanced a first loan of KES 87,880, which will help him in purchasing his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more income that comes with the flexibility of ownership and his already-established customer base.

Samuel plans to use the proceeds to assist his family meet basic needs. He hopes to save enough to buy more motorcycles in the future for business expansion

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle

loans.name: Khoa

texts.en:
