Khoa is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife works in a local factory. Khoa raises insects to sell to his customers, which he has been doing for 10 years. 

Khoa is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more equipment and pens to raise a greater quantity of insects. He hopes to achieve higher sales and  better satisfy his customers' needs. He also hopes that his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and pens to raise insects

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Marivic works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a restaurant.  

Marivic is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her furniture making. 

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her furniture making.

loans.name: Rina Petrik

texts.en:
Rina Petrik is a 20-year old, hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband and 2 daughters, who are in school. Her husband is a carpenter by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past 2 years, he has driven a taxi at night. Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired.

Rina Petrik has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for the repair of her husband's taxi. With the profit from this business, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Rina Petrik desires to provide quality education to her daughters and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en: Mirian is a 36-year-old man from the small village of Zestaponi district. He lives with his brother and parents. His mother is provided with a retirement pension of 150 GEL per month. Despite having a high education Mirian is unemployed. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. The family has two cows and two calves and produces cheese to sell. The income is not enough for the family and Mirian decided to start a trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Mirian's credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. He received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and the Credo Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 2400 GEL to begin to trade fruits and vegetables, he will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell at higher price to generate income.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es: Yobana vive en la ciudad de Patria junto con su familia y es considerada como una persona   trabajadora y responsable, ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes como por ejemplo carros, muñecas, pelotas, peluches y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Girasoles” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar muñecas y pelotas para esta campaña navideña. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Patria está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Yobana lives in the city of Patria which is located in the Kosñipata district of the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru. She lives together with her family and is considered a hard-working and responsible person. She sells toys such as wagons, dolls, balls, stuffed animals, etc. It has been a number of years that she has done this business and things are going well for her due to the effort she puts into her work. She belongs to the “Los Girasoles” communal bank.

Yobana is requesting a loan at this time to buy dolls and balls for the Christmas season. She is grateful and values the loan and promises to pay her installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy dolls and balls for this Christmas season.

loans.name: Sector 3 Esquinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sector 3 Esquinas está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio, todos ellos viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que tienen un clima frió, se puede apreciar verdes campos gracias a sus sembríos y vegetación, su geografía accidentada regala hermosos paisajes. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables, gentiles que día a días luchan para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares para así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, su principal fuente de ingresos es el comercio, crianza de animales y la agricultura, son personas que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Josefina, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del sector quienes poco a poco han ido estrechando sus lasos de amistad.
La Señora Josefina tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos de 19, 17, 15, 11, 8 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que viven es propia.
En su casa Doña Josefina se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos, gallinas y borregos, cultiva sus tierras y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también de domingo a domingo labora como empleada domestica. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener un puesto de venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The Sector 3 Esquinas [3 Corners] credit group consists of five women and one man who all live near Cumbe en Cuenca Parish. The climate in this area is cold, but the countryside is lovely, with verdant fields covered with vegetation and farmers's crops. The people of Cumbe en Cuenca are kind and supportive, and carry on the culture and traditions that their parents passed down to them. These are people who strive each day to achieve financial stability for their families and provide a better future to their children. The main sources of income for people in the Cumbe en Cuenca area are trade, raising animals, and farming. 

One of the group members is Señora Josefina, who is applying for her second loan, along with her friends and colleagues. The bonds of friendship between the group members have gradually been growing stronger.  

Señora Josefina is 37 and the single mother of six children, ages 19, 17, 15, 11, 8, and a baby boy who is only 3 months old. The three oldest children work and help their mother financially, while two children study in a local school. The family lives in their own home. 

Doña Josefina works raising guinea pigs, pigs, hens, and sheep, as well as crops for her family. If any of the harvest is left over, Doña Josefina sells it. She works seven days a week as a housekeeper.  

Doña Josefina will use the loan funds to purchase guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and animal feed. Her ambition is to have her own stand to sell fruit.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. The variety store that she has run for six years now is growing, and she was able to buy more varieties of products. Her income from the loan assisted her in meeting everyday household expenditures. Aside form her variety store, she also has a piggery for additional income. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes that her businesses will continue to flourish and dreams of giving her family a good life and education. She meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nanda

texts.en:
Nanda is married and a mother of nine children, three of whom attend school. The other children are grown ups. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

Nanda sells fruits and green vegetables. In addition, she also sells paraffin. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.
